properties.caption: A pair of bold eyes with bubble tears on the Avenida Nueva Providencia. © Eric Zolov.
Work-in-progress in the bohemian Lastarria neighborhood. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"Embroider your Eyes" (Borda sus Ojos) arpillera at the Museo de la Memoria. Courtesy of the Museo de la Memoria y los Derechos Humanos, Santiago, Chile.
Individual blocks with simple designs or slogans such as "Justice." Courtesy of the Museo de la Memoria y los Derechos Humanos, Santiago, Chile.
"Violence is that the state takes out your eyes." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"They want to take out our eyes because they know that we have already opened them." © Eric Zolov.
"With 200 fewer eyes we can still see": surreal protest graphic in Providencia. © Eric Zolov.
"Chile is not a fool!" / "Dictatorship Piñicheti" / "If it is necessary kill the president." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"Don’t give into the oppressor." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"Free Water / Liberate the Waters." © Eric Zolov.
Brigada Chacón poster: "Peace Can't Land Because a Tyrant Has Blinded It!" © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"In Chile they blind you." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
Hooded female revolutionary figure at GAM. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"Piñera because of you 200 people will not be able to read this." © Eric Zolov.
Portion of Brigada Ramona Parra (BRP) mural on La Alameda. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
